newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's ONA cedes its stake in IBM subsidiary.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's ONA cedes its stake in IBM subsidiary.

text.p: Morocco's largest private company ONA Group ceded its minority stake in International Business Machines Corp's subsidiary in Morocco to IBM, the group said in a statement on Friday.
The IBM unit Elbm was established in Casablanca in 1993, the statement said.
According to 1994 figures, ONA held 49 percent of Elbm capital before the cession.
With a capital of 33.5 million dirhams ($3.8 million), Elbm is now fully controlled by its parent IBM, a Casablanca-based stockbroker said.
"ONA's withdrawal from Elbm firm is a part of the conglomerate's long term strategy to concentrate on the core business such as mining, finance, agro-industry," the stockbroker said.

One of the largest companies in Africa with holdings in more than 100 firms, ONA Group showed a 20.6 percent rise in its consolidated net profit to 328.6 million dirhams in the six months to June 1996 compared with the first half of 1995.
Market analysts expect ONA's consolidated net profit to reach an estimated 720 million dirhams for the full year 1996.
Established in 1919, ONA Group (former Omnium Nord Africain), has a market capitalisation of more than 8.2 billion dirhams.
